newsitem.title: USA: Texas regulators reject pipeline disclosure plan.
newsitem.headline: Texas regulators reject pipeline disclosure plan.

text.p: Texas regulators, siding with large producers and pipeline operators, rejected on Tuesday a plan that would require natural gas pipelines to reveal private contract prices for gas moving on their systems.

The hotly debated proposal, billed as a mechanism for making gas pricing more transparent, was backed by smaller independent producers but ran into stiff opposition from the three republicans on the Texas Railroad Commission.

"I have long said that allegations of widespread, pervasive market abuse are groundless," Texas Railroad Commissioner Carole Keeton Rylander said. "The results of the commission's gathering survey and calls to our complaint line confirm this."

The agency, which regulates oil and gas production in Texas, adopted a "code of conduct" requiring open access to pipelines and and granting the commission new audit powers to investigate alleged abuse.
